nodes.bodyText: This is just a sanity check to make sure that the instances map is in the expected state after the for loop completes. If terminate() is ever changed to not remove the instance then that would go unnoticed, breaking the contract of this method.

Is this cleanup actually required? There's no shared state, so it seems like it would be fine to just drop the component and delete this line and the comment.
If this clean-up is required, then this should probably be within a finally block, because assertNotSame will throw on a failure and then the cleanup won't happen.
